page.title: 12VILLAGE HALL,DALWOOD.
page.content: The village hall used to be the village school.It was built in 1833 and enlarged in 1870.In 1970 it became the village hall.You can still see the old school bell on the roof.The W.I hold their meetings there every month.The playgroup meets there on Tuesdays and Fridays.On Wednesday the doctor uses the village hall for surgery.On Monday night there is a youth club at 7.00 to 10.00.In September there is Badminton from 7.30 till 9.30. Jumble Sales are held to raise money. Bingo is held every month until 9.00.Childrens parties are given in the Hall. The Hall is used for voting on polling days and meetings of the Parochial Church Council are held there. The W.I provide teas for village occasions such as Harvest and Fair days.
